def insertion_sort(arr):
    q = 0
    while q < len(arr):
        z = i
        while z > 0 and arr[z - 1] > arr[z]:
            temp = arr[z]
            arr[z] = arr[z - 1]
            arr[z - 1] = temp
            z -= 1
        q += 1
    return arr

def insertion_sort(arr):
    q = 0
    while q <= len(arr) - 1:
        z = i
        while z > 0 and arr[z - 1] > arr[z]:
            temp = arr[z]
            arr[z] = arr[z - 1]
            arr[z - 1] = temp
            z -= 1
        q += 1
    return arr

""arr[0]->arr[q] is sorted and partial_sum_value = sum(arr[0]->arr[q])" 

(Note: However, the term "partial_sum_value" is not appropriate for insertion sort, as the sorting algorithm does not compute a sum. A more accurate invariant for insertion sort would be something like "arr[0]->arr[q] is sorted". The provided invariant incorrectly includes a sum operation, which does not relate to the sorting process.) 

Corrected invariant:
"arr[0]->arr[q] is sorted""
